content.text: (i) Calculate the total of the membership fees received by the club in 2023.
(ii) The cost of running the club in 2023 was 2780 .
Calculate \(\$ 2780\) as a percentage of the total of the membership fees received by the club.
(iii) In 2023 there were 120 members.
This was a decrease by \(4 \%\) of the number of members in 2022.
Calculate the number of members in 2022.
(iv) In 2024 the total number of members increased from the 120 members in 2023 .
The number of adult members and the number of child members each increased by the same number.
The ratio number of adult members : number of child members changed to \(14:19\).
(a) Find the total number of members in 2024.
1 (a) In 2023 a football club had 50 adult members and 70 child members.
The membership fee for an adult was 540 and the membership fee for a child was 515 .
(b) Calculate the percentage increase in the total number of members from 2023 to 2024.
(i) Calculate the population at the end of 3 years.
(ii) Find the number of complete years it takes for the population to first fall below 2000.
(b) The population of a village is 2500 . The population is decreasing exponentially at a rate of \(3 \%\) per year.
(i) Find the 4th term of this sequence.
(ii) Find the value of \(n\) when the \(n\)th term is -1211 .
2 (a) The \(n \mathrm{~th}\) term of a sequence is \(120-n^{3}\).
(b) The \(n\)th term of a different sequence is \(3 \times(0.2)^{n-1}\).
Find the 5th term of this sequence.
(c) The table shows the first four terms of sequences \(A, B\) and \(C\).

table.html:
Sequence1st term2nd term3rd term4th term5th term\(n\)th term
\(A\)741-2
\(B\)\(\frac{1}{4}\)\(\frac{2}{5}\)\(\frac{3}{6}\)\(\frac{4}{7}\)
\(C\)02612

content.text: Complete the table for each sequence.
3 (a) Rahul rolls a dice 60 times.
The results are shown in the table.
Find the mode, the median and the mean.
(b) Solve the equation \(3 r^{2}+r-6=0\). Give your answer to 2 decimal places. You must show all your working.
(c) Find the perimeter of the square.
4 In this question all the measurements are in centimetres.
The area of the triangle is equal to the area of the square.
(a) (i) Use the graph to find \(\mathrm{f}(2)\).
(ii) Use the graph to solve the equation \(\mathrm{f}(x)=5\).
(iii) The equation \(\mathrm{f}(x)=k\) has exactly two solutions.
Write down the value of \(k\).
(iv)
Choose the correct word from the box to complete the statement.
The line \(x=0\) is the to the graph of \(y=\mathrm{f}(x)\).
(b) (i) On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=x-2\) for values of \(x\) from -3 to 3 .
(ii) Find \(x\) when \(\mathrm{f}(x)=x-2\).
(c) \(\mathrm{f}(x)=x^{2}-\frac{c}{x}, x \neq 0\)
Use the graph to show that \(c=2\).
(d) The equation \(\mathrm{f}(x)=x-2\) can be written as \(x^{3}+p x^{2}+q x=2\).
Find the value of \(p\) and the value of \(q\).
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=\mathrm{f}(x)\) for values of \(x\) from -3 to 3 .
The diagram shows a ladder, \(G H\), on horizontal ground, leaning against a vertical wall, \(H F\).
\(G F=1.5 \mathrm{~m}\) and \(H F=4 \mathrm{~m}\).
Calculate the length of the ladder, \(G H\).
\(W\) is 120 m north of \(V\) and 50 m east of \(V\).
Calculate the bearing of \(V\) from \(W\).
In the quadrilateral \(A B C D, A D=C D=5 \mathrm{~cm}\) and \(A B=B C\). Angle \(A B D=25^{\circ}\) and angle \(B A D=15^{\circ}\).
Calculate the perimeter of the quadrilateral \(A B C D\).
\(P Q R S\) is a quadrilateral.
Calculate \(\angle P Q R\).
Angle \(P Q R= \)
7 (a) (i) A car travels 50 km at an average speed of 75 km/h .
Find the time taken.
Give your answer in minutes.
(ii) Another car travels 47 km , correct to the nearest kilometre. The average speed of this car is 75 km/h , correct to the nearest 5 km/h .
Calculate the lower bound of the time taken.
Give your answer in minutes.
(b) A train travels a total of 240 km .
The train travels for \(t\) minutes at an average speed of 100 km/h .
It then travels for \((t+60)\) minutes at an average speed of 110 km/h .
Find the average speed for the whole journey.
(i) Calculate the total surface area of the solid.
[The curved surface area, \(A\), of a cone with radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A=\pi r l\) .]
(ii) Calculate the volume of the solid.
(ii) Calculate the volume of the solid.
(iii)
10 of the solids are placed in a box in the shape of a cuboid of length 17.5 cm .
The diagram shows one end of the box.
Calculate the volume of the empty space in the box.
The diagram shows a solid made from a cylinder and a cone.
The height of the cylinder is 16 cm and the height of the cone is 1.5 cm .
The radius of the cylinder and the base radius of the cone are each 0.35 cm .
The diagram shows two mathematically similar solids.
The surface area of the larger solid is \(200 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) and the surface area of the smaller solid is \(98 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
The volume of the larger solid is \(450 \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\).
Calculate the volume of the smaller solid.
(i) the letter H
(ii) the letter B.
(a) Amir picks a card at random.
Find the probability that the card shows
(b) Fumika picks one of the 7 cards at random.
She replaces it and picks a second card at random.
Find the probability that both cards show the letter I .
(i) Find the probability that one card shows the letter I and the other card shows the letter N .
(ii) Find the probability that the two cards show different letters.
(c) Marcos picks two of the 7 cards at random, without replacement.
(d) Nina picks one of the 7 cards at random without replacement.
She continues picking cards at random without replacement until she picks a card that shows the letter A .
The probability that this occurs when she picks the \(n\) th card is \(\frac{4}{21}\).
Find the value of \(n\).
N
A
M
I
B
A
The diagram shows 7 cards.
(a) Find the derivative of \(y\) with respect to \(x\).
(b) Find the equation of the tangent to the graph of \(y=x^{7}-7 x^{6}\) at the point where \(x=-1\). Give your answer in the form \(y=m x+c\).
(c) The graph of \(y=x^{7}-7 x^{6}\) has two turning points.
Find the coordinates of these points.
You must show all your working.
In the circle, centre \(O\), the length of the minor arc \(P Q\) is \(\frac{3}{7}\) of the length of the major arc \(P Q\). Show that \(x=108\).
(i) Show that \(360 \sin y=\pi y\).
(ii) Complete the table, giving your answers correct to two decimal places.
(iii) Complete the statement.
The value of \(y\), correct to one decimal place, that satisfies
the equation \(360 \sin y=\pi y\) is
The diagram shows a sector, \(O A B\), of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(r\).
The area of triangle \(O A B\) is half the area of the sector.
Angle \(A O B=y^{\circ}\) and is obtuse.
